tag_list: yukon-palmer, m2m, machine-to-machine, gps, san-diego, bootstrap
overview:
Yukon Palmer is the founder and CEO of FieldLogix. Having started FieldLogix in 2002 with a $3,500 investment, he has grown the company to a customer base throughout North America and millions of dollars in revenues.

His success in leading FieldLogix has lead to the following awards and recognition:

San Diego’s Top 20 Young “Influentials” - San Diego Daily Transcript - 2010

San Diego’s “Metro Movers” - San Diego Metropolitan Magazine - 2010

Selection as one of San Diego’s Most Admired Companies - San Diego Metropolitan Magazine - 2010

Winner of TechAmerica Award for Outstanding Emerging Growth Company - 2011

Ranked as one of San Diego’s Fastest 100 Growing Private Companies - San Diego Business Journal - 2009 & 2010

In addition, Yukon regularly participates in local industry and entrepreneurship events including:

San Diego State University Venture Challenge Judge - 2009-2012

San Diego State University Lavin Program Entrepreneurship Mentor - 2010-2012

Panelist at Agrion’s Green Fleet Conference - 2010

CommNexus - Co-Chair Machine-to-Machine Special Interest Group - 2010-2012

CommNexus - Co-Chair Location Based Services Special Interest Group - 2009-2012

Yukon is married with two children and holds a BS in Business Administration and a MBA from San Diego State University
